entries.meaning: (set theory) (symbol: ⊇) With respect to another set, a set such that each of the elements of the other set is also an element of the set.
examples: The set of human beings is a superset of the set of human children.
The set of characters "LBPG" is a superset of the set of characters "PG".

entries.meaning: (weightlifting) Two or more different physical exercises performed back to back, without a period of rest between them. The exercises may employ the same muscle group, or opposing muscle groups.
examples: While some lifters insist that supersets must consist of consecutive exercises for the same bodypart, others would bet their weight belts that supersets involve opposing bodyparts.

verbs.description: superset (third-person singular simple present supersets, present participle supersetting, simple past and past participle supersetted)

entries.meaning: (weightlifting, transitive) To perform (different physical exercises) back to back, without a period of rest between them.
